DOC.HEAD: Dog Goes For Quick Spin in Dryer
DOC.TEXT: Sheriff's deputies collared a man accused of taking his dog for a quick spin _ in a heavy-duty dryer. Kelly Gay, 32, was in custody Monday with bail set at $5,000 after he allegedly added the 5-year-old mixed terrier to a pile of clothes to a dryer at a self-service laundry, dropped in his quarters and turned it on, said Los Angeles County Sheriff's Sgt. Terry Judge. Other customers rushed to the dryer, shut it off and called sheriff's deputies. The male terrier was still in the dryer when the deputies arrived, Judge said. ``They said it's cute as a button,'' Judge said. The terrier was not seriously injured and given to the custody of animal control workers, Judge said. Gay, who police described as a transient, was held for investigation of animal cruelty.
